hero.title: AI-Focused Computer Science Graduate & Educator
hero.copy: Ranked first in my Computer Science cohort at Soran University, I apply machine learning, cloud, and network engineering skills to solve real problems. I love blending research with practical build cycles—whether I'm guiding students, prototyping AI solutions, or launching sustainability initiatives.

about.heading: Educator, builder, and community advocate
about.summary: I'm a computer science graduate based in Erbil, Iraq, driven by the belief that technology should open doors. From AI research and cloud deployment to volunteer coaching, I invest in work that uplifts learners and communities.
about.who: Based in Erbil, Iraq, I balance academic rigor with hands-on delivery. I lecture on networking and programming, while actively researching AI and building inclusive tech programs.
bring: AI/ML experimentation grounded in real-world deployments
Cloud, data, and network experience across diverse teams
Leadership through teaching, mentoring, and volunteering

facts.description: AI/ML, data, and cloud roles (open now)
Sustainability tech, cloud automation, CS education

skills.heading: Technical range with depth in modern web

items.title: Lecturer — Zagros Institute
items.description: Teaching foundational computer networking and programming, helping undergraduate students connect theory with hands-on labs.
bullets: Designed practical coursework that strengthens core CS skills
Mentored students through project critiques and office hours
Introduced collaborative lab sessions to boost peer learning

items.title: AI/ML Intern — Ovania Company
items.description: Developed and analyzed machine learning models to support production use cases across the company.
bullets: Explored model architectures and evaluation pipelines in Python
Collaborated with engineers to operationalize ML workflows
Documented findings that informed deployment decisions

items.title: Global Solutions Sustainability Challenge — IREX
items.description: Led the Hospitium project to first place, showcasing sustainable tourism through cultural exchange and community partnerships.
bullets: Coordinated research, prototyping, and presentation strategy
Mapped impact metrics that highlighted community benefits
Collaborated across international teams throughout the 8-week sprint

items.title: Volunteer Lead — Hasar Organization & CDC
items.description: Empowered learners through climate-focused initiatives and university career programming.
bullets: Coordinated branch operations and volunteer training
Organized workshops that strengthened employability skills
Built partnerships to expand access to technical education

projects.heading: Selected work
projects.summary: A mix of solo and team projects that highlight my range and curiosity. Each project shipped with attention to user feedback, performance, and maintainable code.

items.title: SchooliSoft — Digital School Management System
items.description: An end-to-end school management platform that fully digitizes academic and administrative workflows. Includes a web dashboard for school managers and two mobile apps—one for students/parents and one for teachers/staff. Automates attendance, grading, scheduling, communication, and academic records.

items.title: Car Parking Management POS
items.description: A POS-based car parking management system designed to automate daily operations and monthly income tracking. The app allows parking operators to register vehicles, calculate fees, generate tickets, and monitor financial reports directly from a POS device. Built for speed, accuracy, and complete parking control without manual paperwork.

link.label: Request details →
link.ariaLabel: Request the Car Parking Management POS details

items.title: Hospitium
items.description: Award-winning sustainability platform from the Global Solutions Challenge that connects travelers with local communities to promote cultural exchange.

items.title: Attendance System Using Facial Recognition
items.description: A real-time facial recognition attendance system built as my final-year project at Soran University. Designed to solve a specific challenge for QA staff, the system automates attendance logging by identifying students instantly and provides real-time monitoring across departments.

link.label: Request details →
link.ariaLabel: Request the Attendance System project details

items.title: Molida Management POS
items.description: A POS-based automation and billing system built for private generator owners. The system automates monthly invoices, tracks income, manages subscribers, and eliminates manual record-keeping. Deployed for four clients, each using the application through a monthly subscription model.

items.title: Practice & Learning App
items.description: An English-learning mobile application built around a story-based method. Users read short narratives and unlock sentences dynamically generated from target vocabulary, enabling natural and context-rich language acquisition.

link.label: Learn more →
link.ariaLabel: Learn more about the Practice & Learning App

items.quote: First-place winner of the Global Solutions Sustainability Challenge (IREX) for leading the Hospitium concept that advances sustainable tourism.
items.caption: Global Solutions Program, 2024

items.quote: Graduated first in class from the Computer Science program at Soran University after four years of high distinction.
items.caption: Soran University, 2025

items.quote: Selected for an exchange semester at Sapienza University of Rome to collaborate on AI research and international coursework.
items.caption: Sapienza University, Spring 2025

contact.heading: Let's build something together
contact.summary: I'm currently open to internship and entry-level opportunities, as well as collaborative projects and research initiatives.
